option.doc:
ESLint allows you to specify the JavaScript language options you want to support. By default, ESLint supports only ECMAScript 5 syntax. You can override that setting to enable support for ECMAScript 6 as well as JSX by using configuration settings.
Configuration settings are set in your .eslintrc file by using the ecmaFeatures property.

ESLint allows you to specify the JavaScript language options you want to support. By default, ESLint supports only ECMAScript 5 syntax. You can override that setting to enable support for ECMAScript 6 as well as JSX by using configuration settings.
Configuration settings are set in your .eslintrc file by using the ecmaFeatures property.
This option allows you to force all variable names to use either camelCase style or UPPER_CASE with underscores.
